intro: Mikania warscewiczii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Mikania warscewiczii is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in many regions. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive velvety texture, which contributes to its common name.
